intro: Oedogocalamus, commonly known as the clubmoss, is a genus of primitive vascular plants belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, scale-like leaves and their ability to reproduce via spores rather than seeds. Oedogocalamus species are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. They play an important role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in their ecosystems. Despite their ancient lineage, some species of Oedogocalamus are still used in traditional medicine and horticulture.
